definition: to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend
to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt

sentences.english: " hind constant with " overcome powerful adversaries " figurative conquer is great and difficult.
sentences.chinese: 后常以“降龙伏虎”比喻战胜重大困难。

sentences.english: There is the story of overcome powerful adversaries in buddhism and Taoism.
sentences.chinese: 佛教和道教中都有降龙伏虎的故事。

definition: to subdue a tiger/fig. to prevail over sinister forces
abbr. for 阿羅漢|阿罗汉[a1 luo2 han4]
lit. to move mountains and drain seas/to transform nature
to have a face as terrifying as a temple's guardian deity (idiom)
outstanding people/water and fire (in Daoist writing)
Laozi or Lao-tze (c. 500 BC), Chinese philosopher, the founder of Taoism/the sacred book of Daoism, 道德經|道德经 by Laozi
Sun Wukong 孫悟空|孙悟空[Sun1 Wu4 kong1], the Monkey King, character with supernatural powers in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]
Great Sage the Equal of Heaven, self-proclaimed title of the Monkey King Sun Wukong 孫悟空|孙悟空[Sun1 Wu4 kong1] in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]
